          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The solution is "],
              ["rethrows", [["b"], ["c"]]],
              [", which designates that the function can only throw "],
              ["if its closure parameter throws", [["b"]]],
              [":"]

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Note that in Swift 3, you no longer mark blocks as @noescape. Blocks are now "
              ],
              ["not", [["b"]]],
              [
                " escaping by default. In Swift 3, instead of marking a closure as non-escaping, you mark a function parameter that is an escaping closure as escaping using the “@escaping” keyword."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }

              ["Closure parameters marked "],
              ["@noescape", [["c"]]],
              [
                " are guaranteed to execute before the function call returns, so using "
              ],
              ["self.", [["c"]]],
              [" is not required inside the closure body:"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 1

          "properties": {
            "language": [["Swift"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class MyClass {\n    var x = 0\n    func showExamples() {\n        // error: reference to property 'x' in closure requires explicit 'self.' to make capture semantics explicit\n        executeLater { x = 1 }\n\n        executeLater { self.x = 2 }  // ok, the closure explicitly captures self\n\n        // Here \"self.\" is not required, because executeNow() takes a @noescape block.\n        executeNow { x = 3 }\n\n        // Again, self. is not required, because map() uses @noescape.\n        [1, 2, 3].map { $0 + x }\n    }\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 7
        }
